pullrequest.title: Refactoring the cmake scripts to use ignition-cmake

content.raw: It was intentional. While the ISO standard is somewhat nebulous about the distinction between `"..."` and `<...>`, in most compiler implementations the meaning of `"..."` is to search for the header in the same directory as the current file before resorting to the lookup procedure used by `<...>`. However, we're specifying `ignition/common/*.hh`, which (if I understand correctly) means that the compiler will always fail to find the file in the "same directory" as the current file, because it will be looking for a subdirectory called `ignition/common/` within the subdirectory `ignition/common/`. Therefore, I think we're misleading the compiler by using quotes. (...not that it really makes a noticeable practical difference, since it will always fall back on the behavior of `<...>` anyway.)
